Legal_Issue: Whether the officer violated procedural fairness by rejecting the application without allowing the applicant to address credibility concerns
Decision_Outcome: Application rejected initially, decision later annulled
Credibility_Factor: Officer questioned credibility of employment letter
Legal_Rule: Applicant must be given opportunity to respond to credibility concerns before rejection
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness (implied by judicial review context)
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide applicant with notice and chance to respond
Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached; case remitted for redetermination
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Violation found due to lack of opportunity to respond
Legal_Framework: Procedural fairness in administrative decision-making under Canadian immigration law
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged rejection based on procedural unfairness
Court_Result: Application allowed, decision annulled, remitted for redetermination
Legal_Rule_Source: Canadian immigration law and administrative law principles
Outcome: Decision set aside, application to be redetermined by different officer
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Perceived lack of credibility in application documents
Governing_Rule: Duty to afford procedural fairness in administrative decisions
